results.title: Phenakistiscope disc (Politeness)
results.brief_description: The phenakistoscope is one of the first devices to create the illusion of motion from still images. A stroboscopic cardboard disc is fitted to the device and when seen through the slots, comes to life.
results.description:
This is one of the first devices to create the illusion of motion from still images. A stroboscopic cardboard disc featuring a sequence of slightly different pictures is mounted on a handle. Around the disc’s rim, above the images, are equally spaced slots. Nothing magical happens when you spin the disc, but the images flicker to life when you peer through the slots at the disc’s reflection in a mirror.

Invented almost simultaneously in 1832 by Joseph Plateau in Brussels and Simon von Stampfer in Berlin, the phenakistoscope was an important predecessor of the zoetrope, and its infinitely looping animation is reminiscent of today’s GIFs.
description_for_label:

results.title: The Brotherhood of St Laurence
results.creator_credit: Brotherhood of St Lawrence Production Co
results.brief_description: The Brotherhood, which is based in Melbourne, works for a better deal for disadvantaged people. This documentary describes the Brotherhood’s beginnings; its current welfare services, including accommodation for older people, a material aid service, and a sheltered workshop; its support for other independent groups; and its involvement in social issues.

results.title: Fast film
results.brief_description: This ingenious cut out animation is the chase film to end all chase films. Borrowing images and characters from various Hollywood classics, ‘Fast film’ then distorts and twists our understanding of where these icons of Hollywood folklore belong. Ultimately mutating into a new narrative where the suave Cary Grant and Frankenstein’s monster happily co-exist side by side.

results.title: Journey
results.brief_description: Inspired by Gary’s neighbour Tony, who emigrated from Italy in 1952. Describes what people had to go through in search of a better life in Australia.

results.title: Lest we forget
results.brief_description: A message from mother to son, Darcy who was born on Anzac day 1996. She wants to explain to him that his father left, but that is not his fault and that she is always there for him.
